title: How?! Haven't played for a while but wth
body: I'm not too sure but isn't the overall money earned suppose to be greater than the money spent. I have just gone over the details of a previous game I have had and all the players except one person has a higher money earned than money spent.

replies.body: Can you go more into detail. Maybe you are talking about the player having like 3k gold WITH him before recalling but spending 4k overall.

I don't know how to post screenshots. But I'll try and explain it to the best of my English. You have the cash you earn, either by over time, or farming minions/monsters/players. The money you earn is known as **Gold Earned**. So the money you obviously spend is known as **Gold Spent**. Now how does someone's **Gold Spent**, becomes larger by 4000, than the **Gold Earned**

selling/undo items doesn't count towards the gold earned factor, but buying adds and doesnt change... had a person who spent 30k gold but only had 7k earned long ago, they just sat and refunded for like 10 min
Alright, thank you for that clarification
What are you trying to say?

That is it even possible to spend more money than what has been earned
Because the game details I was going over, and the player spent 4k gold more than what they had earned.

4k on what?
Game details on what game?

is there another post that we should read before this one?
